raw akas.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry

akas: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry World-wide (English title)
Still, Marry Me World-wide (English title) (alternative title)
City Lovers World-wide (English title) (informal alternative title)
akas from release info: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry World-wide (English title)
Still, Marry Me World-wide (English title) (alternative title)
City Lovers World-wide (English title) (informal alternative title)

1.title: Episode #1.1

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: Best friends Shin Young and Boo Ki are having trouble with their love lives. Da Jung, a former classmate, joins them as they try to conquer single-hood.

2.title: Episode #1.2

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: Stressed at work, Shin Young aggravates young musician Min Jae and paralyzes her own face, forcing her to seek out Ban Seok, an acupuncturist.

3.title: Episode #1.3

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: The three friends visit a love guru in the hopes of breaking their string of bad luck with men.

4.title: Episode #1.4

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: Min Jae makes a bet with Ban Seok that he can win over Shin Young and get her to date him.

5.title: Episode #1.5

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: Shin Young battles workplace politics with Min Jae's help, while Boo Ki confronts the wife of the man she's dating.

6.title: Episode #1.6

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: Ban Seok meets the girl of his dreams - in the form of Da Jung.

7.title: Episode #1.7

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

7.plot: Boo Ki introduces the girls to Sang Mi, who quickly disapproves of Shin Young. Da Jung finds out something about Min Jae that quickly shatters Shin Young's dream.

8.title: Episode #1.8

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

8.plot: Shin Young proposes to Sang Woo that they both get back together. Sang Mi rents out her son's apartment to none other than Sang Woo.

9.title: Episode #1.9

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

9.plot: Shin Young and Min Jae begin their "ten day relationship."

10.title: Episode #1.10

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

10.plot: Sang Woo falls more deeply in love with Sang Mi. Da Jung celebrates a birthday full of awkward and embarrassing moments.

11.title: Episode #1.11

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

11.plot: Sang Mi wants Shin Young and Min Jae to break up, while Da Jung and Ban Seok come up with a plan to win over his father.

12.title: Episode #1.12

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

12.plot: Everyone's relationships are revealed at Da Jung and Ban Seok's wedding.

13.title: Episode #1.13

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

13.plot: Da Jung and Ban Seok's honeymoon goes awry. Min Jae has to deal with his conflicted feelings towards his mother's new boyfriend.

14.title: Episode #1.14

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

14.plot: Complications arise with Shin Young and Min Jae's new living arrangements.

15.title: Episode #1.15

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

15.plot: Sang Mi gets a taste of her own medicine when she meets Sang Woo's mother. Shin Young receives an overseas offer that threatens her relationship with Min Jae.

16.title: Episode #1.16

episode of.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry (TV Series 2010– )

16.plot: Da Jung and Ban Seok work on their marriage. Shin Young's decision takes a toll on Min Jae.

imdb.plot outline: A follow-up of sorts to the hit 2004 drama TheWomanWho Wants toMarry , this refreshing, breezy, entirely modern drama depicts the loves and friendships of three women as they each go through turning points in their lives. Comedic, witty, and addicting, The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry is a little like a Korean take on Sex and the City or Friends , and is led by a cast of appealing, charismatic actors. Park Jin Hee, a film and drama star most recently seen as the female lead in hit drama Money War (2007), takes the lead role as awomanunwilling to sacrifice her career for love. Wang Bit Na is her sophisticated, succesful best friend and Uhm Ji Won is a high school classmate whom she runs into by accident. Rising star Kim Bum ( Boys Before Flowers ) rounds out the cast as a musician who falls for Jin Hee's olderwomancharacter. Shin Young (played by Jin Hee) has never been able to find success in love after breaking up with her fiance for the sake of her career. When her latest boyfriend proposes, she gladly accepts - only to find him with anotherwomanlater that night. Giving up on love, she sees anotherwomanscreaming at her boyfriend for dumping her - Jung Da Jung (Uhm Ji Won), who is a top interpreter but naive and unskilled in love. When the two realize they are old high school classmates, they quickly bond, and their trio is rounded out by Shin Young's best friend who is a successful restaurant consultant but jaded and cynical about love. With charming, stubborn gifted musician Ha Min Jae (Kim Bum) falling for Shin Young and doctor Na Ban Suk (Choi Chul Ho) becoming involved in all their lives, sparks begin to fly, and the women will need each other's help and support as they face the 30-something life with wit, humor, and sometimes something less than grace.
imdb.title: The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry
plot: A follow-up of sorts to the hit 2004 drama TheWomanWho Wants toMarry , this refreshing, breezy, entirely modern drama depicts the loves and friendships of three women as they each go through turning points in their lives. Comedic, witty, and addicting, _The Woman Who Still Wants to Marry_ (qv) is a little like a Korean take on Sex and the City or Friends , and is led by a cast of appealing, charismatic actors. Park Jin Hee, a film and drama star most recently seen as the female lead in hit drama Money War (2007), takes the lead role as awomanunwilling to sacrifice her career for love. Wang Bit Na is her sophisticated, succesful best friend and Uhm Ji Won is a high school classmate whom she runs into by accident. Rising star Kim Bum ( Boys Before Flowers ) rounds out the cast as a musician who falls for Jin Hee's olderwomancharacter. Shin Young (played by Jin Hee) has never been able to find success in love after breaking up with her fiance for the sake of her career. When her latest boyfriend proposes, she gladly accepts - only to find him with anotherwomanlater that night. Giving up on love, she sees anotherwomanscreaming at her boyfriend for dumping her - Jung Da Jung (Uhm Ji Won), who is a top interpreter but naive and unskilled in love. When the two realize they are old high school classmates, they quickly bond, and their trio is rounded out by Shin Young's best friend who is a successful restaurant consultant but jaded and cynical about love. With charming, stubborn gifted musician Ha Min Jae (Kim Bum) falling for Shin Young and doctor Na Ban Suk (Choi Chul Ho) becoming involved in all their lives, sparks begin to fly, and the women will need each other's help and support as they face the 30-something life with wit, humor, and sometimes something less than grace.
